description: 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal box office streak, crossing Rs 1227 crore globally. The film has now become the highest-earning single-language (Hindi) movie, surpassing 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' and other blockbusters. description: Breaking onto the silver screen, Agastya Nanda's 'Ikkis' hasn't quite lived up to the buzz, raking in a disappointing Rs 24.25 crore in its first week. Directed by Sriram Raghavan, this war drama was expected to resonate with viewers, but alas, its Day 7 tally of Rs 1.15 crore suggests it's falling short compared to its competitors.

title: Dhaka: Bangladesh Nationalist Party youth leader shot dead in Karwan Bazar area — report
description: A senior leader of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party's volunteer wing, Azizur Rahman Musabbir, was fatally shot in Dhaka's Karwan Bazar area Tuesday night. Another man, Sufian Byapari Masud, sustained injuries in the attack. Police confirmed the incident, which led to a protest by around 200 BNP activists at the scene.

title: Jabarkhet: can private reserves restore wildlife and keep tourism gentle?
description: Private reserves are popular in Africa. In India, however, responsible private reserves are more about potential than reality. title: ‘Only American products’: Trump says Venezuela to spend oil deal money on US goods
description: Venezuela will exclusively purchase American-made goods, including agricultural products, medicines, and energy infrastructure equipment, using funds from a new oil deal. This significant shift positions the United States as Venezuela's primary commercial partner, a move hailed as mutually beneficial for both nations. The arrangement signals a notable change in Venezuela's economic allegiances.

He also lamented Pakistani players' limited franchise league opportunities due to political dynamics. Holder believes the rivalry has crossed a line, impacting cricket beyond the pitch.

title: Viral! Sooryavanshi’s reaction leaves referee laughing: Here's what happened
description: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi stole the show in the third India vs South Africa U19 ODI, despite an emotional moment at the toss after losing it. The 14-year-old captain bounced back with a stunning 127 off 74 balls, becoming the youngest skipper to score a Youth ODI century. Supported by Aaron George’s 118, India posted 393/7 and crushed South Africa by 233 runs to sweep the series.

title: Govt considers raising EPFO monthly wage cap to Rs 25k-30k
description: A proposal to raise the Employees Provident Fund Organisation's monthly wage ceiling beyond Rs 15,000 is back on the table, with suggestions for an increase to Rs 25,000-30,000. This move aims to bring more low-wage and minimum-wage earners, especially in the unorganised sector, under the social security net.

description: The upcoming midline study would adopt a mixed-method approach and will be conducted across all 15 zones of Chennai and major transit points

title: Hit by Op Sindoor, panic-stricken Pak mounted frantic lobbying in US, reveal official papers
description: Following India's military retaliation against a terror attack, Pakistan urgently sought US mediation to halt New Delhi's strikes.  FARA filings reveal Islamabad's frantic lobbying efforts, involving over 60 contacts with US officials and media.  Pakistan's hired firm, Squire Patton Boggs, aimed to secure American intervention to "somehow halt" India's operations, indicating significant behind-the-scenes panic.

title: CM Nitish orders Bihar officials to hear public grievances at their offices two days a week
description: The CM asserted that a register of complaints received from visitors will be maintained, instructions have been given to all concerned officials to make this arrangement effective from January 19

title: ‘Dream military’: Trump proposes $1.5 trillion defence outlay for 2027, up from $1 trillion
description: President Donald Trump has proposed a $1.5 trillion military budget for 2027, an increase from the previously discussed $1 trillion. He stated this expanded allocation is crucial for building a "Dream Military" to ensure national security amidst global instability. Trump also linked this increased defense spending to revenues generated from tariffs.

title: Breaking law will lead to deportation, US warns students against visa violations
description: The US embassy in India has warned student visa holders that violating laws can lead to visa revocation, deportation, and permanent ineligibility for future US visas. This follows a similar warning for H1B and H4 visa applicants. Recent changes also mandate in-person interviews for most non-immigrant visa applicants.

Unable to move, hippo stuck in Kolkata zoo pool for 2 weeks
description: A young hippopotamus at Alipore Zoo has been unable to move for two weeks, likely due to a neurological disease or leg injury. A medical team is monitoring the animal, which has shown some signs of improvement and is slowly responding to treatment. The zoo is seeking expert advice for a definitive diagnosis and treatment plan.

title: Madras high court bans book with 'scandalous' remarks against Deepam judge

The tanker, previously sanctioned and renamed, had reportedly evaded a US blockade near Venezuela.

The court questioned the board's transparency and sudden reversal, with a verdict expected on release day.

What if Putin imitates Trump and tries a 'Maduro' on Zelenskyy?
description: US forces' capture of Venezuela's President Maduro, framed as law enforcement, has altered global perceptions of state actions. This precedent raises concerns about potential similar moves against leaders like Ukraine's Zelenskyy. However, Ukraine's unique wartime context, strong Western backing, and national unity make such an operation highly improbable for Russia.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
description: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy suggestions, including massive battery, EV, and solar production. He emphasized batteries as key to increasing energy output, citing Tesla's Megapacks and the new Megablock as solutions for grid stability and AI-driven power demands.

title: Google cofounder Larry Page leaves Silicon Valley: Moves assets to Delaware - here's why
description: Google cofounder Larry Page has shifted key business entities, including his family office, out of California to Delaware, Nevada, and Florida. This move precedes a potential state wealth tax, which could cost him billions. Other tech titans are also exploring exits, citing tax and privacy advantages offered by states like Delaware.

title: Tommy Fleetwood and Clare Fleetwood’s net worth: Golf earnings, family, fortune
description: Tommy and Clare Fleetwood have built a significant fortune through Tommy's successful golf career, prize money, and lucrative brand deals. Clare, as his manager, plays a crucial role in their financial success and their private family life. Their collaborative approach has led to both on-course achievements and long-term financial stability.

title: Travis Kelce reaches breaking point as Taylor Swift hits new career
description: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
description: Apple executives are stationed in South Korea, seeking long-term memory chip contracts amid a severe global shortage.  RAM prices have surged dramatically, forcing tech giants like Dell, Google, and Amazon to also establish extended stays.  This "semiconductor boom" is driven by AI demand, impacting smartphone production costs and potentially leading to higher iPhone prices or reduced RAM.

title: David Raya & Tatiana Trouboul net worth: Salary, bonuses, sponsorships
description: Renowned Premier League goalkeeper David Raya, now among football's highest earners, commands an estimated £120,000 weekly from Arsenal. His substantial net worth, valued at approximately £15 million, is further bolstered by endorsements from brands like Adidas and Rosa Blanca. His wife, Tatiana Trouboul, accompanies him to events, with their combined financial profile secured.
